title: Nantes
summary: Nantes (/nɒ̃t/, US also /nɑːnt(s)/,[2][3][4] French: [nɑ̃t] (listen); Gallo: Naunnt or Nantt [nɑ̃(ː)t];[5] Breton: Naoned [ˈnãunət])[6] is a city in Loire-Atlantique on the Loire, 50 km (31 mi) from the Atlantic coast. The city is the sixth largest in France, with a population of 309,346 in Nantes and a metropolitan area of nearly 973,000 inhabitants (2017).[7] With Saint-Nazaire, a seaport on the Loire estuary, Nantes forms one of the main north-western French metropolitan agglomerations.
